data.title: Movies – Page 32 – Gateway Film Center
data.meta_description: On every street in every city, there's a nobody who dreams of being a somebody. Paul Schrader's gritty screenplay depicts the ever-deepening alienation of Vietnam Veteran Travis Bickle, a psychotic cab driver who obsessively cruises the mean streets of Manhattan. | Country: United States | Language: English, Spanish
data.text:
On every street in every city, there’s a nobody who dreams of being a somebody. Paul Schrader’s gritty screenplay depicts the ever-deepening alienation of Vietnam Veteran Travis Bickle, a psychotic cab driver who obsessively cruises the mean streets of Manhattan. | Country: United States | Language: English, Spanish

Read More

The next film from the director of Poor Things (2023) is a triptych fable following a man without choice who tries to take control of his own life; a policeman who is alarmed that his wife who was missing-at-sea has returned and seems a different person; and a woman determined to find a specific someone with a special ability, who is destined to become a prodigious spiritual leader.

Read More

Official Selection, Cannes Film Festival 2023. A collection of stirring vignettes following everyday people from all walks of life as they navigate the cultural, religious, and institutional constraints imposed on them by various social authorities, from school teachers to bureaucrats. | Country: Iran | Language: Persian, English

Read More

The feature directorial debut of Caitlin Cronenberg, daughter of legendary filmmaker David Cronenberg, is a dystopian satire taking place over a single day, mere months after a global ecological collapse has forced world leaders to take extreme measures to reduce the earth’s population. | Country: Canada | Language: English

Read More

Put this in your pipe and smoke it. A lazy stoner is the sole witness to a murder by an evil drug lord and a corrupt cop. Marked for death, he runs for his life, dragging his dazed dealer and his supplier with him on a hilarious pot-fueled adventure. | Country: United States | Language: English

Read More

A lot can happen between Thursday and Saturday… Before the sun sets, Craig must get his friend out of trouble, find a new job so his parents don’t evict him, escape his girlfriend long enough to capture a new woman’s heart, and survive a climatic confrontation with the neighborhood menace. | Country: United States | Language: English

Read More

Join us for a happy hour reception in The Festival Lounge followed by a screening and Q&A with director Mickey Keating and producer and star Joe Swanberg. A young woman arrives in the Chicago suburbs and begins to suspect that something terrible has happened to her missing cousin, but soon realizes that her greatest fears don’t even begin to scratch the surface. | Country: United States | Language: English

Read More

Sex. Money. Power. Drugs. Brace yourself for the legendary filmmaker’s outrageous story of American excess. Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.| Country: United States | Language: English, French

Read More

Nominated for ten Academy Awards, including Best Picture and Best Director. In 1862, Amsterdam Vallon returns to the Five Points area of New York City seeking revenge against Bill the Butcher, his father’s killer. | Country: United States, Italy | Language: English, Irish Gaelic, Chinese, Latin

Read More

Scorsese’s acclaimed psychological thriller follows Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, who are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the implausible disappearance of a patient. | Country: United States | Language: English, German

Read More
